alert.note: Alert for Clark; Hot Spring (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 10:36AM CST until February 11 at 11:15AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock AR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Arkansas... Ouachita River At Arkadelphia affecting Clark and Hot Spring Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ouachita River At Arkadelphia. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Farmland along the river begins to flood. Water over State Highway 7 and 51 at railroad underpass. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 9.5 feet this afternoon. It will rise above flood stage late Thursday morning to 18.0 feet Thursday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Crest Time Date Ouachita River Arkadelphia 17.0 9.1 Wed 9 AM 17.4 15.3 9.9 18.0 6 PM 2/09 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
